item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, August 28, 2024 at 3:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Microsoft donates the Mono Project to the Wine team (850 points | 262 comments)
2. Faster CRDTs (2021) (192 points | 54 comments)
3. A Collection of Free Public APIs That Is Tested Daily (278 points | 61 comments)
4. Rerun: Visualize Multimodal Data over Time (39 points | 1 comment)
5. The End of Finale (11 points | 1 comment)
6. The Monospace Web (250 points | 65 comments)
7. Sainsbury Wing contractors find 1990 letter from donor (269 points | 73 comments)
8. Blitzortung – real time lightning strikes around the world (169 points | 63 comments)
9. Taskwarrior – CLI Task Management (85 points | 26 comments)
10. A Weekend at the Immersion Larp Festival (7 points | discuss)
11. ChartDB – Free and open source, database design editor (37 points | 6 comments)
12. Knockknock: Simple, secure, and stealthy port knocking implementation (20 points | 8 comments)
13. KLEE Symbolic Execution Engine (51 points | 8 comments)
14. Launch HN: Bucket Robotics (YC S24) – Defect detection for molded and cast parts (84 points | 19 comments)
15. Tesla's TTPoE at Hot Chips 2024: Replacing TCP for Low Latency Applications (11 points | 3 comments)
16. DisTrO – a family of low latency distributed optimizers (67 points | 23 comments)
17. EasyPost (YC S13) Is Hiring ( | hide)
18. How Chrome Accessibility Works (38 points | 9 comments)
19. Vulnerabilities show why STARTTLS should be avoided if possible (2021) (72 points | 38 comments)
20. The Simple Algorithm That Ants Use to Build Bridges (2018) (58 points | 13 comments)
21. Anthropic publishes the 'system prompts' that make Claude tick (363 points | 230 comments)
22. Rustproofing Linux (Part 1/4 Leaking Addresses) (2023) (60 points | 11 comments)
23. If Your World Is Not Enchanted, You're Not Paying Attention (74 points | 59 comments)
24. Splatt3R: Zero-Shot Gaussian Splatting from Uncalibrated Image Pairs (120 points | 24 comments)
25. A New Wave of Underwater Comms Is Coming (50 points | 18 comments)
26. Zuckerberg claims regret on caving to White House pressure on content (486 points | 883 comments)
27. Malware infiltrates Pidgin messenger's official plugin repository (146 points | 17 comments)
28. Clay (short for C Layout) is a high performance 2D UI layout library (195 points | 81 comments)
29. Hackers infect ISPs with malware that steals customers' credentials (51 points | 16 comments)
30. The Triple Failure of 2U, EdX, and Axim (227 points | 166 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, August 28, 2024 at 3:15 AM UTC
